title: UK Caldicott Guardian Council

details.body:
A Caldicott Guardian is a senior person responsible for protecting the confidentiality of people’s health and care information and making sure it is used properly.

When making decisions or giving guidance, Caldicott Guardians will often refer to the Caldicott principles, which can be found in the Information Governance Review.

All NHS organisations and local authorities which provide social services must have a Caldicott Guardian.

The UKCGC is a sub-group of the National Data Guardian’s Panel

Aims of the council

The council aims to:

  • be a point of contact for all Caldicott Guardians and for health and care organisations seeking advice on the Caldicott principles
  • enable Caldicott Guardians to share information, views and experience
  • encourage consistent standards and training for Caldicott Guardians
  • help to develop guidance and policies relating to the Caldicott principles

The council has agreed its constitution for 2017 to 2020 UK Caldicott Guardian Constitution (PDF, 14.8KB, 2 pages)

Chair and Vice-Chair recruitment

The Council is recruiting a new Chair and Vice-chair with the experience, knowledge and capability to deliver the ambitious aims of the Council over the next three years.

These will be high-profile national roles within the Caldicott Guardian community, and the successful candidates will need to be strong advocates of, and promote, the roles of Caldicott Guardians. For more details download the person specification and application process.

Caldicott Guardian registration

All organisations which are required to have a Caldicott Guardian should ensure their up-to-date details are on the Caldicott Guardian Register.

Meetings

The next UKCGC meetings are:

  • Wednesday 16 November
  • Thursday 19 January

If you would like more information about the UKCGC, please contact the secretariat.
